title: Dress Panels, mid-18th century
medium:
Medium: silk 
Technique: painted over printed outline on plain weave.
dimensions:
a. Warp: 170cm (66 3/4in.). Weft: (selvage to selvage) 74.5cm (29 3/8in.)
b. Warp: 160.5cm (63 in.) . Weft: (selvage to selvage) 74.5cm (29 3/8 in. ). 
Height of repeat:; 64cm (25 1/4in )
description: The panels were once part of an 18th century dress. 'A' came from the front of the dress, 'B' came from the back. 'A' has a curved bottom for the dress opening.  The design is of isolated sprigs of flowers and berries.

tombstone.epitaph:
Dress Panels, mid-18th century.
mid-18th century. Medium: silk 
Technique: painted over printed outline on plain weave.. Bequest of Elinor Merrell. 1995-50-299-a,b.
